intro: Psychotria viburnoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf psychotria, is a tropical shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is native to parts of Central and South America. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
